summary: George V. Allen, President of The Tobacco Institute, delivered a epeech before the Bright Belt Warehouse Association in 1963. He said that the industry was not seeking youth smokers. The tobacco industry has since been phased out of the U.S. market. It is now more popular with middle-class families.
